_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary



Facility:    Mid - Missouri Agri Services (Enviro) - Emma

Location:    32102 Emma Road, Concordia, Mo. 64020

Contact:     Chris Edwards

Phone:     660-463-7488





1. The Facility Policy



MFA Incorporated and the employees of the Mid Missouri Agri Services (Enviro) - Emma in near Concordia are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Concordia Fire Department, and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.



2. Facility Information



The primary activity at the facility is the receiving, storage and distribution of bulk dry and liquid fertilizer and anhydrous ammonia for direct application as a crop nutrient. The facility also handles pesticides products.



3. The Accidental Release Prevention Program.



The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1, 1999", published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc., the Missouri Anhydrous Ammonia Law and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia".



4. The Five-year Accident History



This is a new NH3 facility as of October of 2008. There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that: have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



5. The Emergency Response Program.



The facility has;

    

      a. a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA Standard, 29 CFR 1910.38;



    b. provided State and Local authorities with the emergency planning and community

          right-to-know information a

s required under SARA Title III (EPCRA);



    c. employees will not respond to any release other than to activate an emergency

           shut-off while evacuating the facility. Local emergency responders will be

           notified to control any release.



6. Planned changes to improve safety.



Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions. Currently the facility is evaluating the requirements of CGA 2.1, 2014 and Process Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals and will make the required upgrades needed.





    10/10/13
